meanings.definition: To make something seem more glamorous or attractive than it really is.
meanings.sent1: She kept overglamorizing her vacation photos on social media.
meanings.sent2: Stop overglamorizing the idea of fame; it's not always as wonderful as it seems.
meanings.sent3: The movie star's tendency to overglamorize even the simplest events became a running joke among her friends.
meanings.sent4: Her stories about the luxurious cruise were so overglamorized that they sounded like fairy tales.
meanings.sent5: The marketing team did a great job overglamorizing the new product to attract more customers.

meanings.definition: The act of exaggerating or embellishing the glamour or appeal of something.
meanings.sent1: The overglamorizing of the fashion industry in movies can create unrealistic expectations.
meanings.sent2: His constant overglamorizing of his achievements made it hard to know what was true.
meanings.sent3: The overglamorizing of the dessert menu made it difficult to choose just one sweet treat.
meanings.sent4: The overglamorizing of the city skyline in the brochure made tourists eager to visit.
meanings.sent5: The overglamorizing of the event's importance led to disappointment when it didn't meet expectations.
